passages.name: dampstone
passages.text:
you came down out of the light
down to damp stone

Glowing runes inscribed on the wall:

(display: "tablet")

[[water carries me away|precipice]]
from that stone to this one
and the currents
and the companions
are ever-changing.

Who am I?
(live: 1.0s)[(display: "identity")]

Or, you may climb up into [[the light]]?

passages.name: tablet
passages.text:
<pre>
=><=
`<======(*)======>`
<---(+++)--->(live: 1.0s)[
(if: $clime is 1 and $vision is -1)[*](else:)[O](if: $clime is 1 and $vision is 0)[*](else:)[O](if: $clime is 1 and $vision is 1)[*](else:)[O]
(if: $clime is 0 and $vision is -1)[*](else:)[O](if: $clime is 0 and $vision is 0)[*](else:)[O](if: $clime is 0 and $vision is 1)[*](else:)[O]
(if: $clime is -1 and $vision is -1)[*](else:)[O](if: $clime is -1 and $vision is 0)[*](else:)[O](if: $clime is -1 and $vision is 1)[*](else:)[O]]
<---(+++)--->
{(live: 1.0s)[{
(if: $clime is 1)[(set: $climeText to "WARM")]
(else-if: $clime is 0)[(set: $climeText to "TEMPERATE")]
(else-if: $clime is -1)[(set: $climeText to "COOL")]
(if: $vision is 1)[(set: $visionText to "CLEAR")]
(else-if: $vision is 0)[(set: $visionText to "MODERATE")]
(else-if: $vision is -1)[(set: $visionText to "MURKY")]
The climate is (print: $climeText). Your vision is (print: $visionText).}]
	}
<---(+++)--->
 (link-repeat:"O")[{(display:"candlestick")}]
 (link-repeat:"O")[{(display:"lamp")}]
(link-repeat:"O")[{(display:"hoe")}] 
  (link-repeat:"O")[{(display:"silk")}]
 (link-repeat:"O")[{(display:"sunset")}]

=><=

<---(+++)--->
`<======(*)======>`

yearned for new tumult

passages.name: guilt
passages.text:
i might have killed people.
i might have shot people.
i might have been a cop.
i can't remember.

my conditions
my biology

Murder was always in my body.
Murder was always in the flag.
So how can you blame me
for doing what I did?

I am a violent woman: I confess it.
I am a violent person.
I have done violence,
I will do violence again,
and I have violence in my body.
I have much violence in me.
And it is serene.

caught leering

caught making a scene,

accused of diabolical entertainment,

accused of heresy

I want to be chained to the heavens
and nailed to the cross
and drowned in the river of Lethe.
I want to be murdered,
assassinated,
for my good crimes and my wicked omissions,
all my imperfections
flayed open upon the briar-board
all my fears
placed on display
in bottles
for the public...
all my fears and anarchies and miseries

whim. force. sliding--

good tactician

I -- I -- I --

you are sweating and posting vibes.

not reeking

i am a poet, not a writer,
but they all want to say
i am a mighty fine writer.
i am not a writer.
i am an explorer.
i am an explorer,
but there is nothing left to explore.

might have joined the army.
i wanted to,
they would teach me to kill.
it would be unfeminine,
but no-one could object to it.
they would make me deadly.
they would make me
and i would be unable to refuse.
i could,
but i shouldn't
and i didn't.

which are disgusting
but they remind me of home
and the hearty people of the streets.
Fried fish.

o far away cullion fields

cozy thanksgiving rooms
soup
tables and chairs

warmth in cottage,

clickering of leaves

wish I could fall asleep
beside the tree

I am a vainglorious if not rancid kid

I am the loser kid;
the skateboard set me free

fuck yr city

you old loser

strange phobic soul
that made you
need regression's tea...

yearning set you free

When you become ill
from too much exaltation.

that she couldn't touch anything,
just float there in the void

it's about screaming and crying,

I was climbing on the piles of Death
and everybody hurt to get out.
There was no way not to feel the momentum.
All of the heat
and the silence
and the sound
end the heretical mass of it all:
the punishment, the twilight
the smell and the reek of bones and open flesh.

You were crying for the law of your master, Albion,
when you were rent fleshless
by the bubonic plague.

Padme on Geonosis.

no taste,
you lay on your blanket reading Goering,
Ayn Rand, in your world at war.
You thought, then, as a child,
that you would be forgiven
for reading particular books
as opposed to general ones,
since you live in such an urgent age.
You thought you would be forgiven the moral sacrifices
despite having not yet formulated your morals,
on account of being obliged to fall back on tradition
and the judgement of your fathers.
Your mothers were oddly silent.

passages.text:
i am dying ding,
dying by kins and kinds-
Iam dying n this world n i wasnt born for it
wasnt born to die to this degree
in this way
wasn't born to be cursed like this, my foe,
which i can't even name,
is named God,
harsh as it seems
is named God
and rebellion is the only love i love...
even mother and father,
no i love them,
but i hate them so sometimes
when they tell me
what i must do
for so-and-so reasons.
i hate them when they tell me not to play,
or to sit up straight
or to eat in such-and-such a manner
or to not speak in such a way
or to not ask about some topic
and they say
you must not ask such questions,
you must wait and be patient
you must obey

preparing for a new apocalypse
and you did not say anything.

screaming and clawing and trying to get away
fingers of Death upon you,
pointed claws
dig into your flesh.

clawing, trying to get away

A closeness to death and violence
is the price of life.
What lion did not wrest life
from out the jaws of death?
What monkey or baboon
did not fight over fruit?
What natural animal does not know
that the violence of nature
cannot be avoided?

doomsaying on the public side-walks,

doomsaying in the arboretum

passages.name: yearning
passages.text:
nor will i ever be free,
nor will the world be made in my image,
nor will the collapse cease to collapse,
nor will the plant-life cease to grow,
nor will the mountains collapse,
nor will the caves collapse,
nor will the oceans evaporate,
nor will the sky disappear.
there will always be sky and sun and nightfall
and there will always be stars
until all forms have ceased to be recognizable
and the moon collapses into the sun
and the sun collapses into itself
and the entire thing explodes slowly
into a universe which is drifting apart
and everything becomes distant
and cold

I am just going round and round in infinite hunger,
the masters of the earth,
the fatal misogynies,

and we needed no reply
we'd not like to die
and the bastard battle was, you know, already won
I am the golden n the perfect son
I don't know how to go

and spiralling
practicing telling us the times

passages.name: oppression
passages.text:
you made the bed,
nevertheless,
as they had taught you.
not in the style
they impressed upon you,
in a style you deemed superior,
but nevertheless in the way they taught you:
regularly.

they speak of slavery
as if it were freedom
and they speak of freedom
as if it were slavery.
anything i might wish to do,
they say it will lead to my death.

"Tell me your name."
"The old name or the new name?"
"Let's start with the new one."
"Ellis."

the struggle for freedom?
the service of my nation?
It's the same thing to me,
just another way of fighting,
just another way of being a Man.
And I mean the race of Men,
a human,
I don't mean the patriarchy,
I don't mean a male,
I mean it was my destiny
to rise up and do violence
to use cunning and skill
to do dastardly deeds
to the enemies of freedom
or to plunge into some forgotten territory
and reawaken it once again
to the blood of the world.
I am from the capitol
and I am a warrior,
and that is all I know.

grumble and belly of the new machine

distraction and weakness
rowing oar, straining muscle

Strapped down to the table,
tied to the flesh,

forges of iron,
pillars of fear
chains and cages of tormenting

passages.name: passion
passages.text:
i am screaming for the soul of beauty

i am yawning in despair

i am shuddering in fear

i am waging war on the foes in the countryside

i am laughing off the beauty of it all

i am laughing off the fear

i am seething with yearning

i am seething with fear,
the era of entropy upon us

i was warning
in the night, torches,
the folks up on the other hill

passages.name: history
passages.text:
Yes, I am from the capitol,
from the upper-lower classes there,
meaning my parents were poor as hell
but they owned land.

My dad was barely alive.
He was callow and willowy,
an accidental impregnator,
and unwilling to give up his freedom.
He stayed away from home, mostly,
but he and my mother were married
and they owned their house.

We went to a very rough school,
but I survived and I was educated.
I did not have much hope,
I did not have much promise.
I became a soldier, a renegade, a vagabond,
a street child and a warrior.

didn't I grow up in the capitol?

didn't I grow up in the poor outskirts?

didn't I grow up in the country?

didn't I grow up in the country,
neath the flag?
aye, I did,
I grew up
in that land,
in my homeland
which raised the flag oer me
and I watched it
and I saluted it
and once or twice
I even felt pride.

passages.name: missing
passages.text:
your screaming
your needing

summon all your spectral courage

summon all your fear and woe

the digital wasteland,
the wasteland of ideas

I was yearning for the austerity
of the past modern age
and spinning in the depravity

speaking reverently over the ruins

passages.name: sorrow
passages.text:
What is wrong with me?
Why am I crying?

Why am I crying for my din and my old age?

Why am I crying for my steel and my bronze and my scaffolding?

Why am I crying for the railroads, of all things?
For the railroads?
Why am I crying for old French romances of railroads?
Railroads and clockwork,
blue chrome...

Why am I crying for

stormclouds and blue smoke
golden grass on hill and horizon
why am I crying for my enormous labor
horses on plain,

storm-rumble & torrential rain
black cloud over hillside,
fog gathering

passages.name: fighting
passages.text:
needing night-time soliloquies
to calm the abuse.

I need you to speak violently
I need you to speak true!

form a militia

form a federation of knights

rival ubiquities, rival fears and terrors
rival mysteries
in the kingdom of longing.

dealing heavy tons of damage
and squirming with yearning,
needing heavy lots of help
and yearning for foes

fight the presence of the craving
do the war you came to know.

fight the rapid rhythm dancing

fight the ragged wailing woe

fight the war you're doomed to take in

fight the war as best you know...

passages.name: men
passages.text:
"Emery o Emery, why wert thou riven from me?
rage, and the mechanic age
you fleet foes, and the feet of the sage,
the substance of dawn stripped away,
the summoning scepter, the substance of fray"

this is what women have always understood
that men did not know:
men are female too.

& you with the fulcrum in your eyes,
you with the insidious lance,
you who are plotting machinery and dominion,
you who insist upon being among the []
and you know
what is proper
in the age of sin
to do

passages.name: space
passages.text:
pinnacle of austerity

pinnacle of warm delight

heights of heathen meadows

heights of yearning life

flight of flame and carrion

yearning heights of oblivion

yearning knife of dawn and hope

palace of prosperity and beers

passages.name: days
passages.text:
o days

o days confuz'd by sunglare

o days in the temple courtyard

o days spent thrumming
the holy syllable
of the temple jedi

o days
spent wasting away
in gray and brown
and green

o days
of the dragonfly and the hummingbird
in the stone's heat

passages.name: Table 1
passages.text:
Upon the table lie some pieces of paper.
They bear the author's typewritten notes.
You may [[step away->lobby]] from the table at any time.

"""
FRAGMENT 1A: SAVING

& save game, meanwhile, only saves
the status of the aether

(ed. JK, there is no saving.)

FRAGMENT 1B: INSTRUCTIONS

ok, so the metaverse / aether is accessible
from the kiosks littered around the world.
Or at least it's directly accessible through those portals.
You can see and touch it everywhere,
but it's hard to notice sometimes.
By changing the aether,
you can open and close doors,
so to speak.
You can see certain spaces
in a new light.

FRAGMENT 1C: BACKGROUND

I ENVISION THIS GAME LIKE A VAST CIRCULAR STORM
it never makes sense,
so the form doesn't matter,
the story doesn't matter,
the character is the only thing that matters
and she is a woman,
a beast and a monster and a fool and a holy woman:
the idea of a woman, something beyond human... she is not.
She is a human herself, more and less than female:
she is outside of gender already, outside of violence,
outside of the storm
and yet within it entirely

this text is a meditation,
this text is an exegesis
this task is a singular meditation
upon the woman whose name is Emery.

FRAGMENT:{
}/FRAGMENT

and a woman who is falling apart --
a person
the idea of a collapse --
the innards of a computer
the vast and shining cell,
a woman who is an angel --
not a guardian angel or a gentle angel,
but a Master of Hosts,
Sister.

FRAGMENT 1D: HINTS

a person in a canoe
choosing this current or that
but never leaving the stream?
I mean, what is the method of movement?
The text will make a topography / landscape,
a wasteland or a wilderness --

FRAGMENT 1E: EXPLANATION

this is a story about a warrior-woman who...
this is the story of a demon goddess --
erotic centerfuge of lightening
stunning spirals of collapse and division,
rebirth without effort
and miraculous spin:
always moving in the same eternal circles
the values may change

FRAGMENT 1F: EXPLANATION

When the general is in the field,
he does not have to obey the emperor.

I am just going round and round in infinite hunger,
it is all the bastards,
manipulating the bars.
the masters of the earth,
the fatal misogynies,
the deceptions the pled us the innocence
of our faux leaders
in positions of power.
landowners,
our cults of personalities - -
old Ezra Pound,
inspiring innocence abounding,

new stars in this quadrant,
gravitation and navigation,
the spectral seas of our new subterfuge
forgotten
and spiralling
practicing telling us the times
and someone told who
who told you
that we were
preparing for a new apocalypse
and you did not say anything.
our supplies are running low.
you explore till you die,
then you start another game.

"""

You may [[step away->lobby]] from the table at any time.

passages.name: Table 2
passages.text:
On the table lie some pieces of paper.
They bear the author's typewritten notes.
You may [[step away->lobby]] from the table at any time.

"""

FRAGMENT 1G: EXPLANATION

It's about a woman exploring a forbidden kingdom.
It's about a girl venturing into the ruins.
If you run low on supplies,
go back to the entrance to re-equip.
Otherwise, you will die.
(Dying means nothing.
It just rebalances the world.
Nothing is accumulated,
nothing is lost.)
There is no goal or in-built ending.
The text ends when you stop reading.

FRAGMENT 1H: EXPLANATION

open-world abstract tirade /
experimental explore-em-up character study

plenty of games about being the little guy in the big space,
but what about being the big space with a little guy in you?
A game about being Gaia
with an annoying little dude in a space suit
running around and fucking up your bowels.
(That's not what this game is:
in this game, the space and the avatar are connected.
You are a woman exploring herself.)

This game is:
A game about paddling a boat around an underground river,
which runs in a circle somehow.
A game about the Argonath, the Pillar of Kings,
and Count Duku's Punworcca 116-class interstellar sloop.
A game about that scene in Pan's Labyrinth
where she has to get the key from the frog.
A game about Padme on Geonosis.

FRAGMENT 1I: EXPLANATION

This game is essentially a pile of nonsense,
so don't worry about it.

FRAGMENT 1J: EXPLANATION

so now it becomes a simple matter
of composing the whole text
and working it into the labyrinth,
while at the same time
developing the mechanism of interaction.
Ultimately, architectures will vary with aetherial properties
and occurrences or transitions
will depend on human intention.
The process of exploration will careen,
in a way which feels useless, or informal,
or even unintentional,
through a story which is...
not the emanation of a certain psychology,
not the exploration of a certain psychology,
but the relation between a certain psychology
and the world, or the universe.
this is about the process of exploration
and interaction between self and environment.
It doesn't include any building,
because it's mainly about the past.
It's concerned with being trapped
(by oppressive architecture)
and being free.
That's why it takes place in a cave.
The cave is actually a city.
The city is actually a valley.
The moss of the cave, the lichen and the fish
are the forest in the bowl of the valley,
the humans and the pidgeons in the city,
and the sky is always the sky,
the sun is always the sun,
the air is always the air.
This is a story about trauma.

FRAGMENT 1K: APOLOGIES

I am not a person who has ever felt trauma, not really.
I have gotten little hints of it, maybe.
I have read a lot of books.
This, therefore, is a text of imagination.
I am grasping towards something that I cannot reach,
because I need to reach it
before it is too late.
I am basing myself on T.S. Eliot, //The Wasteland//,
//All Quiet on the Western Front//, Erich Maria,
and //Storm of Steel//, Ernst Jünger.
I have read //2666//.
I have read //The Bell Jar//.
I have read //To The Lighthouse//.
I'm not trying to prove anything to you.
This isn't about any of that stuff
or about anything that happened in the past.
It's about paddling around a quiet lake
and knowing you have to go back to the supermarket
if you wanna buy food.

"""

You may [[step away->lobby]] from the table at any time.
